content: Germany took control of the Alsace-Lorraine region from France as a result of the Franco-Prussian War, which was fought from July 19, 1870 to May 10, 1871. After a series of military victories, Germany was able to force France to sign the Treaty of Frankfurt on May 10, 1871, which officially ended the war. As part of the terms of the treaty, France ceded control of the Alsace-Lorraine region to Germany.
